sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"相信，信任"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: belief, faith, confidence, conviction, credit, trust
means: belief ： 普通用词，指单纯从主观上的相信，不着重这种相信是否有根据。
faith ： 语气较强，强调完全相信；有时也能仅凭感觉产生的相信。
confidence ： 指对某人某事有充分信心，断定不会使人失望，因而给予信任。
conviction ： 多指根据长期交往或实践，对某人某事有了认识和了解后产生的信心和相信，侧重其坚定性。
credit ： 语气最弱，着重以声誉为信任的基础。
trust ： 强调相信、信任的完全可靠。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"相信，信任"之意。
means: believe ： 普通用词，常表示一种缓和、不太肯定的口气。
trust ： 指绝对相信或信赖某人。
confide ： 侧重忠诚可靠与可信赖。
rely ： 指在相信的基础上可进一步依靠，着重可靠性。

sentence.Network_en: It can be beneficial to share your feelings with someone you trust.
sentence.Network_cn: 向自己信任的人倾诉感情是很有益处的。

sentence.Network_en: That's why I must trust you to keep this secret.
sentence.Network_cn: 那就是为什么我必须得相信你会保守这个秘密的原因。

sentence.Network_en: Jake has raised two smashing kids and I trust his judgement.
sentence.Network_cn: 杰克养大了两个了不起的孩子，我相信他的判断。

phrase.cizu_name: not trust someone as far as one can throw them

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)not trust or hardly trust a particular person at all
it is characteristic or predictable for someone to act in the specified way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 某人做某事乃意料中事，某人（会去）做某事乃其天性使然，某人定会去做某事

lj.lj_ly: trust Sam to have all the inside information.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse traust, from traustr 'strong'; the verb from Old Norse treysta, assimilated to the noun

encyclopedia.content: Trust 名词 n. 1. 信任，信赖[U][(+in)] 2. 托管，信托；管理，照顾[C][U] 3. 【经】托拉斯,企业联合[C] 4. 可信赖的人锛埢蛭镲級[C] 5. 受托物，代管物[C] 6. 商业信货 7. 锛堃蚴芪卸娘級义务，责任[U] 及物动词 vt. 1. 信任，信赖[O2] 2. 依靠，依赖[O2] 3. 想，确信[Y][+(that)] 4. 赊给 5. 托付，托交 不及物动词 vi. 1. 信任，信赖[(+in)] 2. 确信 3. 赊售，赊责 4. 依赖[(+to)] Trust-浜崎あゆみ 歌手：滨崎步 语言

entry.def: If you trust someone, you believe that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you.

example.ex: 'I trust you completely,' he said...
example.tran: “我完全信任你，”他说。

example.ex: He did argue in a general way that the president can't be trusted.
example.tran: 他确实泛泛提过总统不可信赖。

entry.def: Your trust in someone is your belief that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you.

example.ex: He destroyed me and my trust in men...
example.tran: 他毁了我，也摧毁了我对男人的信任。

example.ex: You've betrayed their trust...
example.tran: 你已经背叛了他们的信任。

entry.def: If you trust someone to do something, you believe that they will do it.

example.ex: That's why I must trust you to keep this secret...
example.tran: 那就是为什么我必须得相信你会保守这个秘密的原因。

example.ex: They argued that the ruling party could not be trusted to oversee its own removal from power.
example.tran: 他们争辩说不能相信执政党会监督解除自身的权力。

entry.def: If you trust someone with something important or valuable, you allow them to look after it or deal with it.

example.ex: This could make your superiors hesitate to trust you with major responsibilities...
example.tran: 这样会使上级不敢对你委以重任。

example.ex: I'd trust him with my life.
example.tran: 我愿把终身托付给他。

entry.def: If you do not trust something, you feel that it is not safe or reliable.

example.ex: She nodded, not trusting her own voice...
example.tran: 她只点点头，没有说话。

example.ex: For one thing, he didn't trust his legs to hold him up...
example.tran: 首先，他不相信自己能站起来。

entry.def: If you trust someone's judgment or advice, you believe that it is good or right.

example.ex: Jake has raised two smashing kids and I trust his judgement…
example.tran: 杰克养大了两个了不起的孩子，我相信他的判断。

example.ex: I blame myself and will never be able to trust my instinct again.
example.tran: 我自责，而且今后再也不能相信自己的直觉了。

entry.tran: 希望…是对的;估计…是对的
entry.def: If you say you trust that something is true, you mean you hope and expect that it is true.

example.ex: I trust you will take the earliest opportunity to make a full apology...
example.tran: 我想你会一抓住机会就诚恳道歉的。

example.ex: We trust that he and his department are considering our suggestion.
example.tran: 我们估计他和他的部门正在考虑我们的建议。

entry.def: If you trust in someone or something, you believe strongly in them, and do not doubt their powers or their good intentions.

example.ex: He was a pastor who trusted in the Lord who lived to preach.
example.tran: 作为一名牧师，他相信上帝是用一生去传教的。

example.ex: Don't blindly trust in the good faith of any government official.
example.tran: 不要盲目信任任何政府官员的诚意。

entry.def: A trust is a financial arrangement in which a group of people or an organization keeps and invests money for someone.

example.ex: You could also set up a trust so the children can't spend any inheritance until they are a certain age…
example.tran: 你也可以设立财产信托，这样孩子们只有达到一定年龄才能动用遗产。

example.ex: The money will be put in trust until she is 18.
example.tran: 钱会交付他人托管，直到她年满 18 岁。

entry.tran: 信托基金机构;财产托管机构
entry.def: A trust is a group of people or an organization that has control of an amount of money or property and invests it on behalf of other people or as a charity.

example.ex: He had set up two charitable trusts...
example.tran: 他已设立了两个慈善信托机构。

example.ex: The National Childbirth Trust has recently conducted a survey of 1,271 new mothers.
example.tran: 国家生育信托基金会最近对 1,271 位新妈妈做了一个调查。

entry.tran: 公立医院(由政府资助、独立经营)
entry.def: In Britain, a trust or a trust hospital is a public hospital that receives its funding directly from the national government. It has its own board of governors and is not controlled by the local health authority.

example.ex: St Mary's Hospital in Paddington became a self-governing trust this week.
example.tran: 帕丁顿的圣玛丽医院这周成为政府资助的独立经营医院。

entry.def: If something valuable is kept in trust, it is held and protected by a group of people or an organization on behalf of other people.

example.ex: The British Library holds its collection in trust for the nation...
example.tran: 大不列颠图书馆为国家保存被托管藏书。

example.ex: Works of art are in trust to us during our lifetime.
example.tran: 艺术品交由我们托管一生。

entry.def: If you take something on trust after having heard or read it, you believe it completely without checking it.

example.ex: He was adamant that the allegations were untrue, so I took him on trust.
example.tran: 他坚持认为那些指控不属实，因此我也完全相信他。

means.word_mean: 1. something (as property) held by one party (the trustee) for the benefit of another (the beneficiary);

sentences.sentence: "he is the beneficiary of a generous trust set up by his father"
"he wrote the paper with considerable reliance on the work of other scientists"
"he put more trust in his own two legs than in the gun"

means.word_mean: 3. the trait of trusting; of believing in the honesty and reliability of others;

sentences.sentence: "the experience destroyed his trust and personal dignity"

means.word_mean: 4. a consortium of independent organizations formed to limit competition by controlling the production and distribution of a product or service;

sentences.sentence: "they set up the trust in the hope of gaining a monopoly"

means.word_mean: 5. complete confidence in a person or plan etc;

sentences.sentence: "he cherished the faith of a good woman"
"the doctor-patient relationship is based on trust"
"I believe that he will come back from the war"
"I trust you will behave better from now on"
"I hope she understands that she cannot expect a raise"
"The messenger was entrusted with the general's secret"

auth_sentence.content: The proposals are on the BBC Trust site here.
auth_sentence.res_content: The proposals are on the BBC Trust site here.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The proposals are on the BBC Trust site here.

auth_sentence.content: That you can't trust Labour with your money.
auth_sentence.res_content: That you can't trust Labour with your money.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That you can't trust Labour with your money.

auth_sentence.content: Go to BBC Trust website to have your say.
auth_sentence.res_content: Go to BBC Trust website to have your say.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Go to BBC Trust website to have your say.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实的, 真正的, 忠实的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tru相信,真实+e→adj.真实的, 真正的, 忠实的
trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]+ful表形容词→adj.相信的, 信任的
tru相信,真实+ly表副词→adv.真实地, 不假
tru相信,真实+ce→相信对方而停战
dis不+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→n.不相信,怀疑 v.不信任,疑惑
tru相信,真实+ism学术→真实的学术→不言自明的真理
tru相信,真实+th表名词→n.真实,真相;真实性;真理
tru相信,真实+st→n.&v.信任, 信赖
dis不+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→n.不相信,怀疑 v.不信任,疑惑
en给予+trust[n.&v.信任, 信赖]→给予相信→委托

abbreviation.mean_cn: 托管统治，托管领土，托管人职责

kd.EN: trust sb with sth=trust sth to sb

Sentence.sentence: It uses the experience of someone who already went through the class to help improve your reading (how much you trust each notation is obviously up to you).
She does not trust the man's advice.
For others, the web fosters trust
Would you trust a robot to park your car?
How does Amy Wilkins of the Education Trust view minority students' failure to get a degree
Colleges are not holding up their end," says Amy Wilkins of the Education Trust.

means.word_mean: 信任, 信赖, 相信

sentences.en: The property is merely a trust.
sentences.cn: 这财产不过是一项委托物。

sentences.en: She left money to her uncle to keep in trust for her children.
sentences.cn: 她把钱留给她叔叔, 请他替她的子女保管。

means.word_mean: 照管, 关怀; 职责

sentences.en: She's not yet old enough to be employed in a position of trust.
sentences.cn: 她还年轻, 不能担当重任。

sentences.en: I shall think it is a great trust to obey the wishes of my dead father.
sentences.cn: 我认为按照先父的愿望去做是我重大的职责。

sentences.en: I trust to hear better news from you.
sentences.cn: 我希望从你口中听到更好的消息。

sentences.en: I can't trust what you say.
You may trust me that I'm speaking the truth.
sentences.cn: 你可以相信我在说实话。

sentences.en: You cannot trust him to keep his promise.
sentences.cn: 你可不能相信他会履行诺言。

jushi.english: I have absolute trust in the doctors.
The money isn't mine; it's a trust I'm holding for my youngest brother.
jushi.chinese: 钱不是我的,是我最小的弟弟托我管的。

jushi.english: A trust company undertakes to manage property for anyone.
jushi.chinese: 信托公司为任何人承办财产信托。
